item.title: Report E-2025050266
item.description:
Report E-2025050266

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: ME
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 04/30/2025 at 0632 hours, personnel in the CSXT Yard in Rigby Yard, Portland, ME discovered TILX101251, a loaded tank car containing spent sulfuric acid, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated, and Chemtrade Logistics Inc., the shipper, was notified via CHEMTREC (2025-04-30-00081). HEPACO, a CSXT response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found that the railcar had 20 PSI of pressure left on the railcar from the loading process. The securement chain for the liquid line cap was positioned under the cap, and the gasket showed signs of deterioration. Approximately two gallons of product leaked onto the top of the car as a result. Contractor personnel depressurized the railcar, corrected all defects, confirmed appropriate outage, and decontaminated the top of the railcar. The issue and corrected actions were communicated to Blair Hetherington, the representative from Chemtrade Logistics at 250-525-0179, www.chemtradelogistics.com.
